advanced_stop_line.name: Advanced Stop Line
advanced_stop_line.description: Advance stop lines (ASL) located at traffic signals to provide an area for cyclists to wait for the traffic signals to change ahead of general traffic. The ASL reservoir is the area between the solid stop line, level with the signals, and the ASL for general traffic. The reservoir may have a coloured surface and have a cycle symbol in the centre.

asl_fdr.description:
True = Feeder lane present
False = No feeder lane present (may be gate)
asl_fdr.clarifications: Is drawn in a way which makes entirely clear which road this on, to the left of it
asl_fdr.osmComment: OSM treats ASLs as a node, but the CID has them as a line. No tag for feeder lane exists yet, other than putting the lane on the adjacent highway
asl_fdr.actionNote: Add node for ASL itself, and then when TRUE add cycleway=lane to way

asl_fdcent.description:
True = Feeder lane is in the centre of the Advanced Stop Line
False = Feeder lane is not in the centre of the Advanced Stop Line
asl_fdcent.osmComment: No such tag exists, so proposed tag here, and not necessary of significant use
asl_fdcent.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

asl_fdrigh.description:
True = Feeder lane is aligned to far side of lane
False = Feeder lane is not aligned to far side of lane
asl_fdrigh.osmComment: No such tag exists, so proposed tag here, and not necessary of significant use
asl_fdrigh.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

asl_fdrlft.description:
True = Feeder lane is aligned left next to kerb
False = Feeder lane is not aligned left next to kerb
asl_fdrlft.osmComment: No such tag exists, so proposed tag here, and not necessary of significant use
asl_fdrlft.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

asl_colour.description: Colour of advanced stop line - Limited to only the following entries: None, Green, Red, Blue, Buff/Yellow, Other
asl_colour.osmTag: GREEN: surface:color=greenRED surface:color=redBLUE: surface:color=blueBUFF/YELLOW: surface:color=yellow
asl_colour.osmComment: Taginfo suggests that surface:colour is least uncommon way to represent this, e.g. red is 4,388 cases worldwide: https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/surface:colour#values

asl_shared.description:
True = Shared nearside lane
False = Not a shared nearside lane
asl_shared.clarifications: A shared nearside lane is where a cycle lane or shared bus lane becomes a lane for general traffic turning at a junction.
asl_shared.osmComment: Essentially becomes the road, so no special infrastructure.

crossing.name: Crossing
crossing.description: Crossings intended to be used by cyclists. Crossings may be located at road junctions or in the middle of road links, between junctions. This feature may include pedestrian-only crossings but only where they provide a link intended for cyclists to use between signed cycle routes (e.g. shared footways on both sides of the road or crossings over multi-lane, major or busy roads).

crs_pedest.description:
True = Cyclists must dismount to use
False = Not a pedestrian-only crossing
crs_pedest.osmComment: NB In OSM bicycle=no means no bringing a bicycle at all

crs_level.description:
True = Crossing or rail/tram tracks on cycle lane/track
False = Not a level crossing

crs_segreg.description:
True = Cyclists segregated
False = Shared with other users (e.g. pedestrians or horses)
crs_segreg.query: RWG065968 has no pedestrian crossing shown - does segregated imply no pedestrians

crs_cygap.description:
True = Crossing includes gap in island or kerb allowing cyclists only (NOT a refuge)
False = Crossing does not include gap in island or kerb
crs_cygap.osmComment: OSM has no real equivalent as OSM deals with linear flows rather than spaces

cycle_lane_track.name: Cycle Lane/Track
cycle_lane_track.description: Formally designated road space for cyclists, usually identified with a combination of signs and line markings, and very often marked with the cycle symbol. Cycle lanes are parts of the road marked for use by cyclists. A bus lane that cyclists may use is regarded as a type of cycle lane. Cycle tracks are always off-carriageway, either next to it (associated with the footway) or completely away from the highway (e.g. canal towpaths, routes through parks). The ways that they are signed are more variable than cycle lanes.

clt_advis.description:
True = Advisory lane
False = Not an advisory lane
clt_advis.osmComment: OSM has no differentiation between mandatory and advisory lane. Needs to be an official tag.
clt_advis.actionNote: Community needs to resolve this problem - has long been an issue in OSM. Suggested new tag.

clt_cbypas.description:
True = Bypass allowing turn without stopping at traffic signals
False = Not a cycle bypass
clt_cbypas.osmComment: Simply draw geometry around the signals so that the Way is not subject to a signals Node

clt_mandat.description:
True = Mandatory lane
False = Not a mandatory lane
clt_mandat.osmComment: OSM has no differentiation between mandatory and advisory lane. Needs to be an official tag.
clt_mandat.actionNote: Community needs to resolve this problem - has long been an issue in OSM. Suggested new tag.

clt_parkr.description:
True = Road/lane/track through park
False = Not a park route
clt_parkr.osmTag: TRUE: bicycle=yesIF geometry not already present, also add highway=cycleway
clt_parkr.osmComment: Maintain existing highway type (i.e. footway vs cycleway)

clt_parseg.description:
True = Partially or light segregated lane/track
False = Not a partially or light segregated lane/track
clt_parseg.clarifications: Spec needs careful reading to understand this - means different things when off-road vs on-road: https://www.cyclestreets.net/data/infrastructure/documentation/tflcid/clt_type.pdf
clt_parseg.osmTag: IF clt_carr=TRUEthen:treat as clt_steppp, i.e.TRUE: cycleway=track. Cycleway:track=hybridELSE clt_carr=FALSEtreat as shared-use pavement but with light segregation:highway=cycleway, foot=yes, segregated=yes

clt_segreg.description:
True = Fully segregated lane (i.e. On carriageway) / track (i.e. Off carriageway)
False = Not fully segregated
clt_segreg.clarifications: Segregated and shared are mutually-exclusive options, except for 6 unusual cases which should probably be handled as a special-case.

clt_shared.description:
True = Shared lane (eg bus lane)
True = Shared footway or track
clt_shared.clarifications: Spec needs careful reading to understand this - means different things when off-road vs on-road: https://www.cyclestreets.net/data/infrastructure/documentation/tflcid/clt_type.pdf
clt_shared.osmTag: IF clt_carr=TRUEthen:TRUE: cycleway=share_buswayELSE clt_carr=FALSEtreat as shared-use pavement:highway=cycleway, foot=yes, segregated=no

clt_stepp.description:
True = Stepped lane/track
False = Not a stepped lane/track
clt_stepp.clarifications: Also known as 'hybrid' cycle lane/track, as often found in Copenhagen, etc.
clt_stepp.osmComment: Essentially this is cycleway=track but should be tagged as part of the road probably.
clt_stepp.actionNote: Community needs to resolve this problem - has long been an issue in OSM. Suggested new tag. Will need to resolve whether to treat as part of the road or separate geometry.

clt_waterr.description:
True = Route beside river, canal or other watercourse
False = Not a waterside route
clt_waterr.osmComment: No special tagging needed to represent it being riparian

clt_carr.description:
True = On carriageway
False = Off carriageway
clt_carr.clarifications: The specific extent of each section of cycle lane (which in London can be rather start-top) is very detailed - far better than OSM's.
clt_carr.osmTag: TRUE: cycleway:left=lane or cycleway:right=laneFALSE: cycleway=track
clt_carr.osmComment: If lane, attach to existing highway

clt_bidire.description:
True = Two way flow on lane/track/path
False = Single direction lane/track/path
clt_bidire.osmComment: If geometry is dedicated cycleway, use simple oneway=no rather than oneway:bicycle=no

clt_bbypas.field: Continuous Cycle Facilities at Bus Stop
clt_bbypas.description:
True = Cycle track carries on through the bus stop area 
False = Not a continuous cycle facility
clt_bbypas.osmComment: Simply draw geometry around the signals so that the Way is not subject to a signals Node

clt_colour.description: Colour of lane/track - Limited to only the following entries: None, Green, Red, Blue, Buff/Yellow, Other
clt_colour.osmTag: GREEN: surface:colour=greenRED surface:colour=redBLUE: surface:colour=blueBUFF/YELLOW: surface:colour=yellow
clt_colour.osmComment: Taginfo suggests that surface:colour is least uncommon way to represent this, e.g. red is 4,388 cases worldwide: https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/surface:colour#values

clt_contra.description:
True = Contraflow lane/track (NOT if bi-directional)
False = With flow
clt_contra.osmTag: TRUE:If clt_mandat=TRUETHENcycleway=opposite_lane, oneway=yesELSEcycleway=opposite, oneway=yes
clt_contra.osmComment: Directionality will need to be established
clt_contra.query: clt_contra=TRUE should presuably have clt_advis=TRUE in cases like RWG082002?

clt_priori.description:
True = Cycles have priority, other traffic has to give way
False = Cycles do not have priority
clt_priori.clarifications: This basically refers to retaining continuity at sideroads
clt_priori.osmComment: OSM has no means to represent this, and simply drawing a continuous lane past the sideroad is unlikely to be enough, as many give-way cycle lanes are represented that way.
clt_priori.actionNote: Community needs to resolve this problem - has long been an issue in OSM. Suggested new tag.

clt_ptime.osmComment: No special tagging needed beyond putting opening hours (see below)

clt_access.description: Times route is accessible (either exact times or description)
clt_access.osmComment: Time will need to be converted, e.g. case insensitive conversion of "Mon to Sun 7am to 7PM" to "Mo-Su 07:00-19:00"; free-text descriptions will need further parsing.

cycle_parking.name: Cycle Parking
cycle_parking.description: Cycle parking assets such as cycle stands or racks to which cycles can be locked. In some locations cycle parking consists of lockers or a secure compound.

prk_sheff.description:
True = Sheffield stand (including TfL type) or variant
False = Not a sheffield stand

prk_mstand.description:
True = "M" stand (variety of stand that resembles a letter M)
False = Not an "M" stand
prk_mstand.osmComment: OSM has no differentiation between different variants of sheffield-style stands. Introduction of such a variation is unlikely to be entertained, as downstream users of the data would not consider the difference important.
prk_mstand.actionNote: Worth checking that the community isn't likely to want to add this level of detail beyond bicycle_parking=stands

prk_pstand.description:
True = P, flag or pennant stand (variety of stand that resembles a letter P)
False = Not a "P" stand
prk_pstand.osmComment: OSM has no differentiation between different variants of sheffield-style stands. Introduction of such a variation is unlikely to be entertained, as downstream users of the data would not consider the difference important.
prk_pstand.actionNote: Worth checking that the community isn't likely to want to add this level of detail beyond bicycle_parking=stands

prk_hangar.description:
True = Bike hangar
False = Not a bike hangar
prk_hangar.osmComment: OSM community would probably reject bicycle_parking=bike_hanger as too similar to lockers

prk_hoop.description:
True = Cyclehoop
False = Not a cyclehoop
prk_hoop.osmComment: No such tag currently (though bicycle_parking=bollard is near), but volume of these makes this worth going through standardisation process and using
prk_hoop.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

prk_locker.description:
True = Locker using own or integral lock
False = No locker present
prk_locker.osmTag: TRUE: bicycle_parking=lockersnote=Locker using own or integral lock
prk_locker.osmComment: No current tag for own lock - probably best to add note rather than try to invent new tag as small volume of data

prk_secure.description:
True = Locked compound with shared or combination lock provided by operator
False = Not a locked compound
prk_secure.osmTag: TRUE:bicycle_parking=lockernote=Locked compound with shared or combination lock provided by operator
prk_secure.osmComment: No current tag for own lock - probably best to add note rather than try to invent new tag as small volume of data

prk_tier.description:
True = Multi tiered cycle parking
False = Not a multi tiered cycle parking
prk_tier.osmComment: 6 instances worldwide in use, but needs standardisation
prk_tier.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

prk_buterf.description:
True = Butterfly/wheelbender
False = Not a butterfly/wheelbender

prk_post.description:
True = Post
False = Not a post
prk_post.osmComment: Not 100% the same, but near enough with the same intent

prk_wheel.description:
True = Wheel rack or slot
False = Not a wheel rack or slot
prk_wheel.osmComment: No such tag currently, but are reasonably common around the UK, so worth going through standardisation
prk_wheel.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

prk_other.description:
True = Other or unknown type of cycle parking
False = Not an unknown type of cycle parking
prk_other.actionNote: Done on case-by-case basis; will need manual review

prk_carr.description:
True = On carriageway
False = Off carriageway
prk_carr.osmComment: OSM has no tagging support for this at present, but this would be useful
prk_carr.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag
prk_carr.query: Please send through a photo as no examples yet

prk_provis.description: Number of stands or discrete units
prk_provis.actionNote: Ignore, as capacity is value relevant to OSM (see next)

prk_cpt.description: Number of bikes that can be parked without difficulty

prk_cover.description:
True = Covered or sheltered (including partial shelter)
False = No cover

restricted_point.name: Restricted Point
restricted_point.description: Restricting elements such as steps or lifts.

rst_steps.description:
True = This feature is only relevant where steps link routes where cycling is permitted.
False = No steps
rst_steps.osmComment: Incline=up/down is recommended but doesn't seem to be heavily-used these days, and can be implied by the router anyway; in cycling terms the directionality is not very important, as it is full dismount operation anyway.

rst_lift.description:
True = This feature is only relevant where a lift links routes where cycling is permitted.
False = No lift

restricted_route.name: Restricted Route
restricted_route.description: Short linking routes, on links that form part of signed or otherwise designated cycle routes, that cyclists may use if they dismount.

res_pedest.description:
True = Pedestrian-only route linking cycle routes
False = Not a pedestrian-only route

res_steps.description:
True = Route includes steps to/from a particular cycle route which form part of a linear link route
False = No steps
res_steps.osmComment: Incline=up/down is recommended but doesn't seem to be heavily-used these days, and can be implied by the router anyway; in cycling terms the directionality is not very important, as it is full dismount operation anyway.

res_lift.description:
True = Route includes lift to/from a particular cycle route which forms part of a linear link route
False = No lift

res_bridge.description:
True = Route includes a pedestrian bridge
False = Route does not include a pedestrian bridge
res_bridge.osmComment: The value for layer potentially would need checking in case passing over more complex area.

res_tunnel.description:
True = Route includes a pedestrian tunnel/subway
False = Route does not include a pedestrian tunnel/subway

signage.name: Signage
signage.description: Signs and markings that provide information to cyclists about where they are going, where they can/cannot cycle, and what space has been designated for their specific use adding to the sense of safety and accessibility. Only those signs relevant to cycling are included.

ss_arrow.description:
True = Contraflow or one-way
False = Not contraflow or one-way
ss_arrow.clarifications: Represents path present as lane data anyway, e.g. RWG075567 is sign for lane RWG135732.

ss_bussmb.description:
True = Bus symbol
False = Bus symbol not present
ss_bussmb.clarifications: May indicate bus lane, which will be present as lane data anyway, e.g. RWG074937 is sign for lane RWG082029.

ss_cycsmb.description:
True = Cycle symbol or marker 
False = Cycle symbol or market not present
ss_cycsmb.clarifications: May be physical sign or painted on road. Very general attribute. Best to make use of TRSGD number instead to disambiguate type.

ss_dismou.description:
True = Cyclist dismount sign
False = Not a dismount sign
ss_dismou.osmTag: TRUE: Where target road is visually inferred to be predominantly for pedestrians, set highway=footway, bicycle=yes
ss_dismou.osmComment: Caution is required here in tagging. A Cyclists dismount sign in the UK, which is a recommendation that can be ignored (unlike a No cycling sign), does not mean the same thing as bicycle=dismount, which refers to cyclists being required to dismount and wa
ss_dismou.actionNote: OSM community needs to have a proper way to represent the UK recommendation Cyclists dismount, but this is a massive can of worms. OSM wiki pages https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:access#Access_tag_values and https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Bicy
ss_dismou.query: Was this intended to include unofficial signage which has no legal basis, e.g. RWG107990 and probably RWG075952?

ss_end.description:
True = End of route sign
False = Not an end of route sign
ss_end.clarifications: May be physical sign or painted on road.

ss_greenw.description:
True = Greenway sign, symbol or marker
False = Not a Greenway sign, symbol or marker
ss_greenw.clarifications: Generally rather locally-specific routes, not many.
ss_greenw.osmTag: TRUE: Add relation, with route=bicycle, network=lcn
ss_greenw.osmComment: Seem to be very localised, so network=lcn most appropriate

ss_lcn.description:
True = London Cycle Network sign or symbol
False = Not a London Cycle Network sign or symbol
ss_lcn.osmComment: Very likely indeed to be present already as is high-profile data.

ss_ncn.description:
True = National Cycle Network sign, symbol or sticker
False = Not a National Cycle Network sign, symbol or sticker
ss_ncn.osmComment: Very likely indeed to be present already as is high-profile data.

ss_pedsmb.description:
True = Pedestrian symbol
False = Pedestrian symbol not present
ss_pedsmb.clarifications: Best to make use of TRSGD number instead to disambiguate type. Accompanies lane which is more useful, e.g. RWG107871 represents lane RWG108055.

ss_quietw.description:
True = Quietway sign or symbol
False = Not a Quietway sign or symbol
ss_quietw.clarifications: Quietways not present as adjacent cycle lane/track data, so is useful
ss_quietw.osmComment: Quietways have good coverage already, so this is likely to be a low-priority implementation task. Maybe more useful to do visual verification that signage follows the Ways.
ss_quietw.actionNote: Join up locations to create routable lines, then associate with nearby ways.

ss_smb.description:
True = Taxi/Motorcycle/Horse symbol
False = Taxi/Motorcycle/Horse symbol not present
ss_smb.clarifications: May be physical sign or painted on road. May indicate bus lane, which will be present as lane data anyway, e.g. RWG075621 is sign for lane RWG082675.

ss_superh.description:
True = Cycle Superhighway sign, symbol or marker (NOT totem)
False = Not a Cycle Superhighway sign, symbol or marker
ss_superh.clarifications: Route adjacent will be present in the data, so this attribute is not useful.

ss_road.field: Road Marking (if true) or Sign Face (if false)
ss_road.description:
True = Road marking or symbol
False = Sign face
ss_road.clarifications: Which type of signage this is - road marking or actual sign
ss_road.osmComment: Not useful, as will be other tags that contains the actual information (e.g. TSRGD number)

ss_exempt.description:
True = Exemption text present (i.e. "Except cycles")
False = No exemption text
ss_exempt.clarifications: Needs to be read in conjunction with other attributes, e.g. except cycles for contraflow, or cycles exempted from no right turn, etc.
ss_exempt.osmTag: Needs more detailed analysis. May be possible to ignore as other fields e.g. ss_noleft may cover

ss_left.description:
True = All traffic must turn left with exception
False = No compulsary left turn
ss_left.clarifications: Cycles are exempted from the required left turn
ss_left.osmComment: In theory may not always be required if the target street is cycle-only, as the turn ban is in practice implemented by routers; purpose of restriction could b either (1a) to ban motors turning or (b) to indicate the target street has no motor provision.
ss_left.actionNote: Ideally perform additional check for target street to be marked as e.g. cycleway, but this will not always be the case.

ss_noexce.description:
True = Banned straight ahead movement with exception
False = Straight ahead movement not banned
ss_noexce.clarifications: Cycles are exempted from the required straight ahead
ss_noexce.osmComment: In theory may not always be required if the target street is cycle-only, as the turn ban is in practice implemented by routers; purpose of restriction could b either (1a) to ban motors turning or (b) to indicate the target street has no motor provision. S
ss_noexce.actionNote: Ideally perform additional check for target street to be marked as e.g. cycleway, but this will not always be the case.

ss_noleft.description:
True = Banned left turn with exception
False = No banned left turn
ss_noleft.clarifications: Cycles are exempted from the banned left turn
ss_noleft.osmComment: In theory may not always be required if the target street is cycle-only, as the turn ban is in practice implemented by routers; purpose of restriction could b either (1a) to ban motors turning or (b) to indicate the target street has no motor provision.
ss_noleft.actionNote: Ideally perform additional check for target street to be marked as e.g. cycleway, but this will not always be the case.

ss_norigh.description:
True = Banned right turn with exception
False = No banned right turn
ss_norigh.clarifications: Cycles are exempted from the banned right turn
ss_norigh.osmComment: In theory may not always be required if the target street is cycle-only, as the turn ban is in practice implemented by routers; purpose of restriction could b either (1a) to ban motors turning or (b) to indicate the target street has no motor provision.
ss_norigh.actionNote: Ideally perform additional check for target street to be marked as e.g. cycleway, but this will not always be the case.

ss_right.description:
True = All traffic must turn right with exception
False = No compulsary right turn
ss_right.clarifications: Cycles are exempted from the required right turn
ss_right.osmComment: In theory may not always be required if the target street is cycle-only, as the turn ban is in practice implemented by routers; purpose of restriction could b either (1a) to ban motors turning or (b) to indicate the target street has no motor provision.
ss_right.actionNote: Ideally perform additional check for target street to be marked as e.g. cycleway, but this will not always be the case.

ss_circ.field: Circular Sign (if true) or Rectangular Sign (if false)

ss_destn.description:
True = Direction sign
False = Advisory sign

ss_lnsign.description:
True = Delineating line
False = Delineating sign not present

ss_name.clarifications: Needs further detailed work during implementation, but generally seems to duplicate other data, e.g. adjacent path data
ss_name.osmComment: Further investigation needed but likely to be best to discard. Signs can be represented using e.g. traffic_sign=GB:960.1, but does the OSM community want 118,893 signage locations? Very few signage locations currently, but e.g. https://www.openstreetmap.o

ss_nocyc.description:
True = Sign prohibiting cycling (No Cycling)
False = Sign not prohibiting cycling
ss_nocyc.actionNote: Pre-associate with the relevant highway way(s) then discard the node itself
ss_nocyc.query: Why does RWG062919 state restriction but there is no line under "Restricted route"

ss_noveh.description:
True = No vehicles except pedal cycles pushed
False = Sign not prohibiting vehicles
ss_noveh.clarifications: (1) By contrast to ss_nocyc, this example has associated restriction, e.g. sign RWG063862 relates to Restricted route RWG153136. (2) Has been used for Pedestrian zone in RWG063862; additional access information is present but needs to be considered in con
ss_noveh.actionNote: Pre-associate with the relevant highway way(s) then discard the node itself

ss_nrcol.description:
True = Yes a number in a box is present 
False = Number is box isn't present
ss_nrcol.clarifications: Is about typographic arrangement. Route number will be present separately in the data.

ss_patch.description:
True = Marking/symbol on coloured background patch
False = No colour
ss_patch.clarifications: Relates only to a background colouring of the sign itself, and is not about e.g. cycleway colour

ss_routen.osmComment: Very likely indeed to be present already as is high-profile data.

ss_access.description: Times route is accessible (either exact times or description)
ss_access.clarifications: Duplicates adjacent lane data in clt_access
ss_access.osmComment: Better to use the lane data in clt_access as that is more closely associated with geometry

ss_facing.description:
True = Facing oncoming traffic but on off-side (i.e. right)
False = Not facing oncoming traffic
ss_facing.clarifications: Relates only to physical angling of a sign

signal.name: Signal
signal.description: Traffic signals at which there are specific benefits for cyclists, which includes signals that have been designed or reprogrammed so that the phasing gives advantage to cyclists and improves their safety moving through the junction.

sig_early.description:
True = Early release for cyclists
False = No early release for cyclists
sig_early.osmComment: Currently no support for this but may be useful in improving cycle safety in routing. Suggested new tag.
sig_early.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

sig_gate.description:
True = Cycle/bus gate allowing cycles to get ahead of general traffic
False = Not a cycle/bus gate
sig_gate.clarifications: Essentially this is a physically-separate section of cycleway/busway
sig_gate.osmComment: Needs to be drawn on as additional cycleway as is physically separate. Whether to use track/share_busway needs observation of photos.

sig_head.description:
True = Cycle symbol on signal (as a light or set of lights with symbols)
False = No cycle symbol on signal
sig_head.clarifications: This is about physical presence of a cycle symbol, but only sometimes about head-height signals per se - can just be a filter on a general traffic light set
sig_head.osmComment: Not useful - essentially duplicates other provision e.g. signal on separate cycle track, and OSM is not really concerned with signal phasing issues.

sig_separa.description:
True = Separate stage for cyclists
False = No separate stage for cyclists
sig_separa.clarifications: This is about a separate stage in timing terms but not early release
sig_separa.osmComment: Not useful - essentially duplicates other provision e.g. signal on separate cycle track, and OSM is not really concerned with signal phasing issues.

sig_twostg.description:
True = Two stage right turn (where signed)
False = No two stage right turn (where signed)
sig_twostg.clarifications: This is actually a signage addition within the lights, rather than signals per se, e.g. "No right turn -- Except in two stages"
sig_twostg.osmTag: TRUE: highway=cycleway, bicycle:oneway=yes added as short spur after lights. Could be expressed as relation also, with except=bicycle
sig_twostg.osmComment: Also useful for general mapping of turn restrictions, e.g. RWG070837 and nearby locations.
sig_twostg.actionNote: Needs community discussion as is complex case.

traffic_calming.name: Traffic Calming
traffic_calming.description: Traffic calming measures that are intended to reduce the speed of motor vehicles. It generally comprises vertical and horizontal deflections. Traffic calming assets were recorded for on-carriageway features. For example, speed humps on fully segregated cycle lanes should not be captured.

trf_barier.description:
True = Barrier that cyclists can pass
False = No barrier
trf_barier.actionNote: Check whether community would prefer explicit access=no, bicycle=yes, foot=yes included, as these are explicitly known here, though they are the tag defaults

trf_cushi.description:
True = Speed cushions in line across road
False = Not a speed cushions in line across road

trf_hump.description:
True = Speed hump
False = Not a speed hump

trf_narow.description:
True = Chicane, narrowing, build-out or other horizontal deflection to traffic flow
False = No carriageway narrowing
trf_narow.clarifications: If speed hump or similar is also present, will be expressed as separate asset in same location

trf_raised.description:
True = Raised table at junction
False = Not a raised table

trf_calm.description:
True = Other traffic calming measure
False = No an 'other' type of traffic calming
trf_calm.osmComment: Various random things. Could subsequently be upgraded by manual inspection of photos to more specific types.

trf_entry.description:
True = Side road entry treatment (raised in some way including continuous footway)
False = Not a side road entry treatment
trf_entry.osmComment: OSM currently has no notion of representing a continuous sidewalk. Could be represented on the Node as sidewalk=yes,continuous=yes, or on the Way where the pavement is separately represented. Continuous would be a new tag. If community is divided, represe
trf_entry.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

trf_sinuso.description:
True = Hump or cushion is sinusoidal
False = Not a sinusiodal hump or cushion
trf_sinuso.clarifications: Is a property additional to type
trf_sinuso.osmComment: New tag needed, additional to the traffic calming type itself
trf_sinuso.actionNote: Community consultation needed for proposed new tag

borough.description: Borough in which asset is located
